original_title: Sri Lanka rupee closes at 319/323 against the US dollar, bond yields up
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s bond yields were up at close on Tuesday and the rupee closed at 321.50/90 against the US dollar, dealers said.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2025 closed at 29.00/30 percent, up from 28.75/29.25 percent on Friday.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 closed at 27.00/10 percent, up from 26.80/27.10 percent.
The rupee opened at 321.50/90 to the US dollar in the spot market steady the last close at 321.50/75. (Colombo/April24/2023)
